headline: Avocado Egg Salad
description: I made this recipe up when I had an abundance of avocados and wanted something other than guacamole. I shocked myself at how tasty this egg salad was and my honey loved it too!
name: Avocado Egg Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the eggs with a fork in a mixing bowl to break up. Add the avocado, onion, pickle, mustard, and mayonnaise. Gently smash the ingredients together until blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: It's good but not great. I got carried away mashing the mixture and ended up with more of a paste, not unlike guacamole instead of an egg salad. I think the key word here was 'gently'.
Tastes awesome and I don’t like egg salad
Definitely a make again. Will reduce the onion just a tad, and add a bit more of the pickles. Loved this recipe though!
I made this but I kinda lost my way at the end. 10 eggs and more sweet ralish. It is good

First, I haven’t reviewed an Allrecipes recipe in years! But the bones of this ovo-cado egg salad recipe are THAT good, I had to. Second, I give it 4 stars instead of 5 because, for me, 2 avocados/6 eggs would have been too much ‘cado and too little ovo. So, I started with 1 avocado (easier to add than subtract), mashed it, stirred it up with all the other ingredients, and, finally, added 7 cubed eggs. For the egg/‘cado sizes I was working with, this was absolutely perfecto! Other than that, I followed directions like a good girl... mostly... and I ended up with the best egg salad I think I’ve ever made. And basically guilt-free, too (I doubt I used 1/3 c. mayo; I just kinda eyeballed it, scooping in a li’l spoonful). I didn’t have a red onion either, so I just used 1/2 a li’l sweet onion I had. I wonder if a red onion would have made it too quacamole-y for me when what I want is egg salad, not guac. I did add a tbsp of balsamic vinegar, and, yeah, YUM! For the salt/pepper combo, I used a Himalayan salt/garlic mill and some celery salt and Penzey’s California Blend Pepper. It was so good, BEFORE the flavors even had a chance to marry. Perfect amount, too: it filled up a 4-cup Pyrex. This will be my go-to for egg salad from here on. THANK YOU, AngelaandJakers, for inspiring me to, at long last, put the two best fats on the planet together, one animal and one vegetable, into ovo-cado salad! Best of both worlds.

Made today (10/10/2020). Cut the recipe in half. Used Vidalia sweet onions as that's what I had (I prefer sweet onion so usually buy that) and sweet pickle relish as I didn't have sweet pickles. The avocado I had was overly ripe but I used it. The taste that stood out was the relish. I probably won't make this again. It wasn't terrible but it also wasn't exceptional.
Delish, I added NM green Chile's n jalepenos for a NM twist muy bueno
Excellent! I added celery and swapped sweet onion for the red. I’ll definitely make it again!
Delicious (without the pickles):)
I added a little cilantro and lime juice too,
One of my favorites!! Love it!!
Egg-cellent
This is delicious and satisfying as written. Loved it!
I took out the fresh onion and replaced it with pinion powder. (I am unable to eat fresh onion), and added a little fresh chopped celery. It was fantastic!
Made this while isolating at home. It turned out great and I will certainly make it again. Maybe one less egg and a bit more avocado? A little less mayo? I love playing with recipes.
delishous
A nice light meal with toasted bread. The egg and avocado pair well together. Very easy to throw together when your short of time.
I really enjoyed this. I only made it for 2 so I just eyeballs the ingredients. Next time I will use more pickles, I love the crunch it adds. I served in Hawaiian rolls, was delish.
Incredible! Swapped out mustard with dried mustard and sweet pickles with dill pickles. Yum! I left out the mayo, no need for it!! Love love love this recipe, could eat this everyday. ??
This is a fantastic recipe. It’s delicious. The only word of advice is that the avocados should be as ripe as possible to help with the mixing process.

I made the salad for a quick lunch and topped it on a green salad. It was yummy! I chopped up a dill pickle spear for the sweet pickle ingredient. I didn’t have pickled relish as some have used. I may add paprika or red pepper for some spiciness.
The combination of egg, avocado, and onion is a blank canvas. Today I added tahini and pickled ginger. Yum!
Good but not exceptional.
It was good when it was fresh. The next day, the red onion flavor took over.
I substituted light mayo. Made a half-batch. WW app says its only 5 SP per serving. It was pretty good.
We loved it! I omitted the sweet pickle and added a pinch of Paprika.
This was great. I added bacon for texture and flavor. Simply shred some lettuce in a bowl and add the salad to it.
Didn’t quite make it for me...In my opinion, an egg salad is best at its simplicity...
Simple and easy to make. I was liberal on the ingredient portions.
I just use one avocado and two small eggs for my own breakfast, served with one piece of toast. It's a very nice, quick and easy recipe.

The only thing I did was cut the recipe in half because if we did not like it, I did not want to waste. But it was amazing! I will be making this again!
*Also used the baking process from this site to "hard boil" the eggs. Really impressed with those as well.
I had to make it with only one avocado since I only had one. It still turned out delicious! Hubby loved it!
This was really good, nothing fancy here, simple to make, but great for an easy summer dinner.
Does not last very long, but still very tasty!
Used a Texas sweet onion instead of the red, just out of handiness.

I love this recipe! Made it exactly as written with one minor exception: I used scallions rather than red onion, since scallions are the only type of onion I am not allergic to. I also always squeeze a little lemon juice on avocado when cooking with them to keep them from turning brown. Thanks for a great recipe!
Great little recipe. Really didn't change the taste of the typical egg salad sandwich but a great way to use avocado!
What a great recipe. Everyone here wanted to like the dis, even the dogs!

This was good. I made a few adjustments - I used dill instead of pickles, Dijon mustard in place of regular, Greek yogurt instead of mayonnaise and less in quantity, added lemon juice, red wine vinegar, and paprika. I know it’s a lot of changes, but this recipe gave me a great base to start from.
I added the juice of 1 lemon and substituted mayo for mayo made with avocado oil and it was absolutely the best egg avocado salad I've ever had. I will make this again.
Delicious exactly as written. Thanks to reviewers for the tip about the avocado pits, it works very well!
SOOOOO good!!!!
This was wonderful I used relish instead of the chopped sweet pickle and it was great!
Great base recipe! I kicked it up with diced jalapenos instead of the relish/pickles and a squirt or two of lime juice
Super tasty! I added some white vinegar and ate it as dip with corn chips

My husband loooovvves this! And, well, me too!!! And everyone who's tried it from my kitchen ;)
(P.S. I prefer using dill relish, which I use in my version, and it's SO good this way... and Miracle whip is just great in this, also. Just a thought if you're trying it out!)
Super healthy...crazy it can taste like this! Enjoy! :)

I diced the egg and avocado and used sweet onion instead of red onion because that is what I had on hand. When I realized that I didn't have pickles, I used capers instead. It was delicious! I would definitely make it again.
My husband only likes very basic egg salad. So I made that and added avocado and sweet pickle relish to my sandwich. It was pretty good.

This was GREAT! I took other people's suggestions, left out the Mayonnaise (El Esposo doesn't need the additional calories, nor do I!) and added a bit of Chili-Garlic sauce to kick it up a notch. I mashed the egg yolks with the avocado, and then cut up the boiled egg whites to give it some texture. Another word to the wise (I'm a southern CA gal, so avocados are a staple), yes, DO put a layer of plastic wrap right over the mix, within the container, then cover the container. the lack of oxygen will keep the mix from taking on a gray-ish color. That's simply oxidation on the outer layer, and it looks a bit ugly. The plastic wrap stops that from happening!
Was nice recipe but now I can't afford my house. Living on streets now but brunch was great!
Yum! Great way to get avocado and eggs as good fats into my keto way of eating!

ew, I hate the combination.
Sorry, its just the texture and color, and the flavour.
When I first read the recipe I thought it sounded a little strange but OMG it was so delicious!! My picky husband even loves it.
Yum! But next time I make this I'm going to add bacon crumbles and a touch of lime juice... then serve it on toast with a slice of provolone cheese!
I wouldn't change a thing...the sweet relish was a good addition with the yellow mustard.
Definitely will make again-delish!

So yummy! Took other suggestions and added a squirt of lime juice and Roma tomatoes. Substitute Dijon for regular mustard and sweet pickle relish vs. actual pickles. Tried it on tortillas which was good, but I think I liked triscuits better for the crunch. Next time I'll try it on toast.
I had some leftover guacamole to use up, so I tossed in that in place of the avocado (and onion), served it on a bed of baby spinach, and it came out great!
So amazing! Loved it!
Great sandwich! Enjoyed every bite.
I love the combination of the egg salad and avocados. I can't believe I never thought of it before. This is my new favorite sandwich spread, and have made it several times now. Wonderful!

I made a half recipe. I also added tomato and bacon for sandwiches like some of the other reviews suggested! Amazing. I will use this recipe again to replace my egg salad! I also used cracked pepper and Himalayan salt and gf bread.

Can't rave about this recipe enough. I have made it three times with eggs and it went over well. I have also tried it with tuna and chicken as the protein and it works well with all of them. Great protein heavy dish full of green goodness. I did make one change, but it was minor, instead of yellow mustard, I used Dijon and it really gives a bit more bite to the dish. Great recipe.
mmm mmm good

Avocados + eggs = awesomeness! I had to substitue red onion for green onion since that's all I had. I replaced the relish (not a fan) with regular pickles chopped, & lastly added paprika. This was so yummy! I loved it & so did my girlfriend. This will definitely be a staple in our house!

I made a half-batch just to try it as-written. It was really creamy, but perhaps a bit too sweet for my liking. Next time, I will add less pickles but overall it was a good recipe. I will make it again, just not right away.
Great recipe.

My daughter is a vegetarian and we tried this recipe because I wanted to add extra vitamins to an egg salad sandwich. I added a bit of lime juice so the Avacado would stay green, not for flavor. Thanks for the recipe!

I saw this and threw some eggs in my pressure cooker and whipped this together. It was delicious. I did add some jalapeños because we like spicy. Total is July 4th and I am making it again for our BBQ.
Delicious! Used yellow onion and sweet relish because that's what I had. Definitely see myself having this several times a week for lunch
I didn't add the mayo (didn't need it with 2 avocados), used Dijon and used a diced yellow onion instead of red (I had a yellow one already). Will be making this again and again (great paleo lunch!)
I used dill pickles instead of sweet pickles, family loved it and so did I!!!
I used dill pickles instead of sweet pickles, family loved it and so did I!!!

I was intrigued by the avocado, and I wasn't disappointed! I did add/replace a couple of things according to my taste. Chopped cucumber instead of pickle relish (fresher tasting), and spicy brown instead of regular mustard. Lined my sandwich with spinach, lopped on a bunch of this, and probably could have finished 2 sandwiches! Thanks for this!
This is fantastic! Would definitely make it again.
Amazing! And I don't usually like or eat egg salad. I didn't have any red onion in the house so I used a regular yellow onion, and it was still delicious.
Yes to both. I used dill pickles and Dijon mustard. I made it organic. Yummy.
My family and I really liked it. I didn't have the pickles on hand so I used dill relish. I also used a truffle mustard instead of yellow mustard. It turned out yummy.

I made this as per instructions and it really was delicious, served on slices of sourdough bread as open-faced sandwiches. However I found that a sprinkle of freshly grated mature cheddar on each sandwich added a tangy kick. Like previous reviewer Dana I also half submerge an avocado pit into any leftover mixture before sealing in an airtight container, to prevent the avocado from turning brown.
Run out of mayo so put in only half as what recepy is asking .. And still tasted delicious.

Loved the idea of using healthy avocados to my basic egg salad. Made 1/2 the recipe to try the concept. Used 3 HB eggs, 1 ripe avocado, which made it creamy and easy to mash, no need to dice. Used 2 Tbs finely diced white onion, 1/4 c. Miracle Whip, which has less cholesterol than mayo and sprinkled dry mustard to taste. Omitted pickle because husband does not like them. Certainly easy to serve on the side for those who love pickles. Used lightly toasted whole wheat bread, which yielded 2 thick and healthy sandwiches and no leftovers to worry about discoloring.

I will definitely make this again! What a great taste, and it was so easy, too! I served the salad in lettuce cups and enjoyed every bite! Next time, I will add chopped tomatoes and bits of bacon, and maybe use tortilla chips on the side. Thanks for a very easy dinner.
Halved the recipe....it was delish...my new standard egg salad recipe...

Delicious!! I left out the pickles (personal preference - I don't like them) and used about 1/4 of a small onion. So yummy!! While I love mustard in my egg salad, I might leave it out of this recipe next time and see what I think. And adding a diced, roma tomato would be a nice addition. So many ways to tweak and personalize! :)
Turned out amazing!!!
I used less than half the mayo it called for, and it was still great. I also used some yellow onion instead of red, because that's what I had. Good way to use up leftover dyed eggs from Easter!
This has now become my go to recipe!

Green eggs are good! Even without the ham:). I had tried another recipe on this site that was similar but did not include the mayonnaise and it was very bland. The mayo makes a huge difference. Mine ended up very very creamy, perhaps my avocados were big, so I needed another egg. I was looking for an easy way to get more monounsaturated fat in my diet and egg yolks and avocados are full of it. The mayo even has some. This goes down super easy which is important to me because I am looking for a way to keep weight on and it's been hard (due to nausea caused by medication). I added a small amount of very finely minced celery and used a shallot instead red onion. I also squeezed some lime in. Even with the lime and keeping the pit in with the salad, it goes brown faster than I can eat it. Thank you.
I made this recipe exactly as it said and it was absolutely amazing! I will definitely be making it again. Such a great healthier option, thanks for posting!
good, go a little light on the onions or they can be overwhelming
This was great! I used white onions instead of red, and dill pickles instead of sweet. Loved it!
Very good! I held off on the sweet pickles, cut down on the mayo and mustard, and spiced it up with some garlic powder, seasoned salt, dill weed and a touch of cumin.

This is the best! Absolutely love it! so healthy too. As other reviewers suggested, I put a pit in the left over salad to help lessen the oxidation (browning). This doesn't keep long because we go right through it. The only tweak I made was add 1 tbs sriracha sauce for a little heat.
I will never eat regular egg salad again! Not that I was ever a fan of egg salad, but this recipe is excellent. The mixture of flavor a is perfect!
Loved it! For breakfast I didn't add pickles and put it on toast. Yum!

I used 3 avocados, onion powder, & sweet relish. I also added a dash of salt, white pepper, & turmeric. I replaced mayo with Miracle Whip. Very creamy, should've stuck with 2 avocados. I also did not have red onion on hand. Still pretty yummy!
It was very good, but just seemed to be missing something. I will probably make it again but try some minor adjustments. Thanks for sharing!
Great recipe.

This was really good! A nice change from the normal egg salad. I gave 4 instead of 5 because it seems like it needed a little more seasoning of some sort. Maybe fresh cilantro next time? I used diced cucumber instead of pickles only because thats what I happened to have and Dijon mustard because I prefer its flavor. Will definitely make again!
